org.platanios.learn.math.combinatorics

Class CombinatoricsUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.math.combinatorics.CombinatoricsUtilities

  • public class CombinatoricsUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of several static methods for performing combinatorics related tasks.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private CombinatoricsUtilities() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int getBinomialCoefficient(int n, int k)
      Computes the binomial coefficient indexed by n and k, also known as "n choose k".
      static int[][] getCombinations(int n, int k)
      Computes all possible ways of picking k items out of n items irrespective of the ordering of those items.
      private static int[][] getCombinations(int n, int k, int startIndex)
      Computes all possible ways of picking k items out of n items irrespective of the ordering of those items and without using items with value < startIndex.
      static int[][] getCombinationsOfIntegers(int[] index, int k)
      Computes all possible ways of picking k integers out of a specified set of integers irrespective of their ordering.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CombinatoricsUtilities

        private CombinatoricsUtilities()

    • Method Detail

      • getBinomialCoefficient

        public static int getBinomialCoefficient(int n,
                                         int k)
        Computes the binomial coefficient indexed by n and k, also known as "n choose k". The value of that coefficient represent the total number of ways in which k items can be picked out of n possible items, irrespective of the order in which they are picked.
        Parameters:
        n - The total number of items
        k - The number of items to pick
        Returns:
        The number of possible combinations

      • getCombinations

        public static int[][] getCombinations(int n,
                                      int k)
        Computes all possible ways of picking k items out of n items irrespective of the ordering of those items. The items are represented as all integers between 0 (inclusive) and n (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        n - The total number of items
        k - The number of items to pick
        Returns:
        An array containing one integer array for each possible combination of items, where each integer in that array corresponds to an item

      • getCombinations

        private static int[][] getCombinations(int n,
                                       int k,
                                       int startIndex)
        Computes all possible ways of picking k items out of n items irrespective of the ordering of those items and without using items with value < startIndex. The items are represented as all integers between 0 (inclusive) and n (exclusive). This method is used in the implementation of getCombinations(int, int).
        Parameters:
        n - The total number of items
        k - The number of items to pick
        startIndex - Integer specifying which items to use (items with value less than that integer are not used)
        Returns:
        An array containing one integer array for each possible combination of items, where each integer in that array corresponds to an item

      • getCombinationsOfIntegers

        public static int[][] getCombinationsOfIntegers(int[] index,
                                                int k)
        Computes all possible ways of picking k integers out of a specified set of integers irrespective of their ordering.
        Parameters:
        index - The set of all possible integers out of which to pick the combinations
        k - The number of integers to pick
        Returns:
        An array containing one integer array for each possible combination of integers
